Metadata.Title: Be Aware That BasicHttpBinding Will Not Protect Sensitive Data by Default
Metadata.DirectLink: Be Aware That BasicHttpBinding Will Not Protect Sensitive Data by Default
Metadata.Priority: J.D. Meier, Jason Taylor, Prashant Bansode, Carlos Farre, Madhu Sundararajan, Rob Boucher, Steve Gregersen

Content.Data:
Applies to

  • Microsoft® Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) 3.5
  • Microsoft Visual Studio® 2008

What to Do

If you use basicHttpBinding, be aware that message security and transport security are turned off by default.

How

All of the bindings, except for basicHttpBinding, have either message or transport security turned on by default. If you want to secure your WCF messages on the network, you will need to explicitly turn on either message or transport security for basicHttpBinding.

Additional Resources

  • For more information on choosing a transport, see “Choosing a Transport”  at http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms733769.aspx
